Row.Text: Massagetae Confederation
The Massagetae
Massagetae

Oh fearless Tomyris, queen of the confederate Massagetae tribes, protector of your homeland and people. The Massagetae are an ancient people, adept horse riders and gold workers said to inhabit the east of the Caspian Sea for thousand of years, until the time of the great migrations forced your people to find new home in distant lands.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Oh fair queen, with your battle worthiness proved in war against the persians, your people look for you to once again guide and protect them. Will you answer their call? Will you build a civilization to stand the test of time?
History
The Massagetae were an ancient Eastern Iranian nomadic confederation inhabiting the steppes of Central Asia east of the Caspian Sea.
Jaxartes
Oxus
Aral
Chorasmia
Kara-kum
Arys
Sarysu
Chu
Bedbaht
Ryn
Atyrau
Tengiz
Ajaguz
Lukina
Nura
Byan
Sytasty
Bugun
Ayat
Qapal
Spargapises
Marthax
Samahe
Respendial
Artystone
Batraz
Tomiride
Srayanka
Taymuraz
Zarana
Tomyris
History
Tomyris was an ancient Eastern Iranian queen who led her armies to defend her nation against attack by Cyrus the Great of the Achaemenid Empire, and defeated and killed him in 530 BC.
Tomyris
Leader of the Massagetae
Queen
Unknown
Unbent Plains
Transfer some of the experience points from killed Massagetae units to nearby friendly units. Units gain +1 [ICON_MOVES] Movement Point when adjacent to enemies inside friendly territory.
Battle-Axeman

Unique Swordsman replacement for the Massagetae that is unlocked at Horseback Riding and requires no resource of Iron, but is slightly weaker. Gain extra [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for every used [ICON_MOVES] Movement Point of adjacent units.

When speaking about the Massagetae, Herodotus said: "They fight both on horseback and on foot, neither method is strange to them: they use bows and lances, but their favourite weapon is the battle-axe. Their arms are all either of gold or brass. For their spear-points, and arrow-heads, and for their battle-axes, they make use of brass; for head-gear, belts, and girdles, of gold. So too with the caparison of their horses, they give them breastplates of brass, but employ gold about the reins, the bit, and the cheek-plates. They use neither iron nor silver, having none in their country; but they have brass and gold in abundance."
Scythian Goldsmith

+15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for mounted units. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from worked [ICON_RES_HORSE] horses and [ICON_RES_GOLD] gold resources. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production per source of [ICON_RES_SHEEP] sheep and [ICON_RES_COW] cattle worked by this City. Upon construction, nearby sources of [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron are converted into [ICON_RES_GOLD] Gold. Upon building a Mounted Unit, gain culture based on the number of [ICON_RES_GOLD] Gold resources near this city.
Proto-Cataphracts
+25% Combat Strength when attacking, defending and protecting against ranged attacks.
Encase the Horses

Horses are part of the daily life of every Massagetae. It's from them that we get our drink, wage war and appease the gods, and although we bred them to be finest beasts, they still aren't safe in the heat of battle. By fully enclosing the horse with the most sturdier armor, we will not only protect their lives but also perform much better charges.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be the Massagetae [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May not be enacted after the Classical Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have researched Horseback Riding [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Cost} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Horseman units receive +25% Combat Strength, +25% Combat Strength against ranged attacks and +15 Experience.

Our horsemen now ride to war in fully enclosed armor, protecting against any damage the enemy can throw at us![NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Horseman units receive +25% Combat Strength, +25% Combat Strength against ranged attacks and +15 Experience.
Sacrifice the Mightiest

The greatest Massagetae horse rider of this era lingers to old age. We must sacrifice him to bring us all glory, to appease the gods and to attain his might![NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be the Massagetae [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have either a mounted unit or a Great General in the Capital [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Unit is killed [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Every unit adjacent to the capital gains extra experience based in the level of the sacrificed unit (Highest possible if Great General). [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Gain {1_Faith} [ICON_PEACE] Faith. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Gain {2_Culture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
The mightiest horse rider of our time has been sacrificed to the gods!
Be wary of your next moves, foreigner, for under my command lies dormant the wrath of the Massagetae and you are the one who chose to awake it.
You could not have picked a worse time to stumble upon my lands. What brings you to these pastures?
You are never defeated till you're dead. There's still one last charge for me.
Bugger off already.
I will accept no such insult.
Either propose a better deal or crawl back to where you came from.
This is infuriating! Do you not understand that I will not accept this?
You sure seem to like these lands; it's a beautiful country, isn't it?
You sure do like talking to me don't you?
You sure seem to like these lands; it's a beautiful country, isn't it? So bugger off, it isn't yours.
Behind me lies the army of the last man who bothered me this much.
Welcome. What brings you this far?
Greetings, friend. What news do you bring from your homeland?
Hail.
I'm happy to see you again.
Hail.
Why have you come?
What brings you this far from home?
Go on.
Why are you here?
Yes?
I advise you to pick your words very carefully.
By the skies, why are you here?
Oh, get on with it already.
Darkness approaches. Have you come to bring us light?
I know when I have failed. Do you bring the terms with you, or is this the end of me?
We have spilled much blood already. Is it not enough for you?
Too many sons won't see their fathers again. Please, let's end this war.
This has been going on for too long. Please, let us have peace.
No; I will quench your thirst of blood first.
The vultures are still hungry.
Peace will never come for your men. The vultures await them.
You dare show your face here after what you have done?
Hail there, friend of the Massagetae. What brings you here today?
It won't be long before we'll have dealt with {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey}. He won't live to regret his mistakes.
I hope you're looking forward to the downfall of {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} as much as I am.
Soon we'll have dealt with {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} once and for all.
How's your little war going? Spilled much blood already? Killed many sons? What do you want here, warmonger?
I look forward to hearing the tales of valour of your men. Is there anything that I can help you in this war?
I see your military forces near my borders. Are you here to foolishly threaten me? Do you not realize that we can just ride away from your army?
Yes, you have quite the army. Move it away now, could you?
The spread of your cities and people is like a plague infecting the land. I look forward to the day I don't have to see it any more.
You expand too much, brother. If this continues, I'm afraid that soon there will not be enough space for all of us.
Your theft of all the territory in your empire showcases your greed. You know that will catch up with you eventually, right?
Be careful while purchasing so much land at once, you might end up angering the wrong person.
I've heard many tales of the bravery of your men. To face them in battle would be truly glorious, but I hope it doesn't come to this.
I've heard tales of the wealth of your empire. Truly splendid.
Yes, tiny one? Stumbled upon my lands by accident?
I'd say that your army is a joke, but it appears that you don't even have one. Truly shameful.
Ah, the bloodthirsty one shows his face. And what business does he have with me?
Are you making fun of me? I barely know you!
Brother, {1_CivName} is truly a disgrace for this world. Will you help me, and the rest of the world, by denouncing him?
This is truly a shame. To think that I once called you friend...[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
What a disgrace. Truly shameful.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])

Working with you made me realize what a terrible person you were. I will do a favour to the world and make it very clear who you truly are.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
This was all a mistake. You are no friend of mine, and I don't think that you ever was.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
So?
Honestly?
Does this even matter?
I was right about you, it seems... Well, bugger off then.
Friends with {1_CivName}? Oh, good. Well then.
Friends with {1_CivName}? Umhum...
So you dislike {1_CivName}? Poor judgement.
So you dislike {1_CivName}? Truly wise indeed...
If you are friends with {1_CivName}, then so am I. May this lead us all into prosperity.
{1_CivName} is truly disgraceful indeed. I will aid you in this matter.
If I have to deal with both you and {1_CivName}, then so be it.
I've heard that you and {1_CivName} don't get along. They are truly wise, indeed.
I see your armies amassed near my empire. Attack or flee, pick one already.
You have amassed quite the army near my borders. I hope you aren't intending on using it against me. That would be most unwise.
It seems your word is worth nothing, as your conquest of {@1_MinorCivName} shows. How despicable. The world will know of your crimes.
Your wanton aggression against {@1_MinorCivName} does not go unnoticed. You will face serious consequences should you continue assault.
Your expansion efforts are an insult. Turn away or there will be consequences for this.
You seem to be expanding into lands which I regard to be mine. Last time someone did this, it did not end well.
Your habit of claiming every bit of land you've spotted has not gone unnoticed. A truly distasteful habit.
You expand near my lands. Very near. You either quite like me or hate me. Either way, here will I stand.
You do not move one step closer! You have claimed to many lands already!
Your words might mean nothing, but my axe sure does. You have been warned.
For many years we have lived side by side without dispute. Why are you making trouble now? Stop this plot buying nonsense!
You have brought some good pastures that once belonged to my people. I hope this is enough for you?
A liar, and a thief. Disgraceful.
I am very disappointed. You have lied to me, and I do not take this lightly.
You have proven yourself to be a good friend for me. Am I a friend for you?
You have proven yourself to be a good friend for me. Am I a friend for you?
I know you very well, and I don't quite like not even a bit of it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
The blood thirsty {1_PlayerName:textkey} is danger to us all. Will you do what is right?
The time for war has come. {1_PlayerName:textkey} must die.
Your actions are unforgivable. Never will our nations be friends.
I see your true face now. You will always be an enemy for the Massagetae, and I will treat you accordingly.
I want to thank you for being a good friend for so many years; may this never end.
It is clear to all that you are a wise and mighty ruler. I ask that you might also be compassionate towards those like myself who are weak.
Oh great one, my hope is that you will long serve as a paragon of strength and virtue for lesser leaders such as myself.
Your blood thirst has not gone unnoticed. Should you keep it up, I might just quench it myself.
It's quite clear now that you're a blood thirsty warmonger. A true shame.
Your warmongering is a popular topic these days. How many sons have died because of you?
Your thirst for blood is truly insatiable. For your own sake I hope that you don't bring your warmongering sentiments here, or I will finally quench it.
Getting friends with {1_MinorCivName:textkey}? They are a member of the Massagetae confederacy, and I'd like to keep it that way...
I've noticed your friendship with {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. I'm happy that it's not just me that sees potential in them, but I'd like if you let their protection to me.
We've been over this before. The answer is still no.
Very well. Although I am displeased that you felt the need to ask me this, I understand.
So be it. I will not settle near your lands. I hope you don't intend on settling near mine either..
These lands are mine, if anything it was you that should have settled away.
Yes, may our friendship bring our empires together.
I am happy to call you a friend.
I am happy to accept. May our empires prosper in friendship.
I must decline.
Sorry, but no. Perhaps another time.
I fear that such an arrangement is not in my best interests, so I must decline.
Let's hear your offer.
What do you propose?
Is your thirst for blood satisfied. Shall we have peace already?
There is no point in this conflict continuing any further. Let us return to peace.
We must not let war define who we are. The time has come to make peace.
You have something I want. And so I shall have it.
Unfortunately things aren't going terribly well over here. Can you spare something for a friend? I'll try to return the favor when things are going better for me.
Although it pains me to do so, I must ask for your assistance this day.
Your great strength is a model for all other empires. I ask that you show generosity towards those less fortunate.
I believe it's in our mutual interest to allow free passage between our two great empires.
Opening our borders to one another can only serve to solidify our friendship.
I would like to negotiate passage through your territory.

I would like to lay plans for establishing a Research Agreement with your great nation. Doing so would require each of us to spend 150 [ICON_GOLD]. What do you think?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE](Agreeing will not form a Research Agreement yet)
I feel that a Research Agreement is a mutually beneficial arrangement that would help serve to cement our Friendship.
This deal strengthened our nations and our bonds of friendship. Shall we renew this deal and continue our shared prosperity?
This deal has faded in our eyes over the years. To renew this deal, we would need more from your side of the negotiation.
You have a resource that we require.
I will personally quench your thirst for blood. Meet me in the battlefield.
I might not succeed, but I can try. You must die.
I will summon the forces of all the Massagetae. Death will come, and the vultures are hungry.
I will not fall before you! All the Massagteae will be summoned to fight; you will die!
So be it. My armies will fight to the death against your wicked forces.
You will forever be known as a villain who preys on the weak. But don't you worry, the good always triumphs.
With all our might we will fight. The strength of all my people will descend upon you in one single charge, and once it is done there will be nothing left.
The fury of the Massagetae will fall upon you. Nothing will remain, and no man will return.
You have given me a chance, and I will take it. Death will come to you; I'll make sure of it.
The fury of the Massagetae will fall upon you. Nothing will remain, and no man will return.
Your actions fill me with sadness, but blood must be spilled. I'll make you pay.
You would attack us in such a manner? Your hubris knows no limits. I hope that you will one day be judged for this.
Taking advantage of another's weakness is unnecessary in the pursuit of victory. Surely you know there's a better way?
How could you do such a thing? Begone, you vile being.
To think that one day I called you friend... You fill me with sadness.
I've had enough of you.
You have betrayed your word. The world will know of your treachery, but regardless you won't be alive by then.
Our proximity has fated us to be enemies. Let us see which of us is fit to survive in this land.
You are too close for comfort. There's space for only one of us in these lands.
Your lands will make a fine addition to my own.
Our friendship was true, but alas this must be done. May your passage be swift.
Your weakness is my opportunity. It saddens me, but this must be done.
I'm not happy with this turn of events, but this must be done in the name of my people.
I have to admit, I quite liked you, but it's time for you to die.
The odds are clearly not with me, but as it must be, it will.
So be it. My armies will extract it from your lands then.
Then war it is.
What are the terms?
What would you suggest?
What is the price of peace?
There can be no peace today.
This is not the time for negotiation.
We still have business to settle.
Blood still has to be spilled, I'm afraid.
We'll see.
Right.
My decision was the best for my people and my nation.
Thank you for heeding our request. An artifact made by our ancestors belong to us.
